the 'colony 5' image has this on it: /media/iso/pool/main/l/linux-meta/linux-image-386_2.6.12.15_i386.deb
Seems nice. This is a package that I can install over Warty?
I would suggest you just upgrade to breezy.
if colony 5 doesn't have a new enough kernel, you can update the kernel using the online repositories anyway
you can download a newer kernel using a different box and copy the .deb file over if you need to.
the kernel is in 'main', along with lots of other stuff.
you can find the most recent breezy kernel here: http://packages.ubuntu.com/breezy/base/linux-image-2.6.12-9-386
you can "apt-get build-dep <package>" to get the packages you need to build <package>
